metadata.title: CVE-2022-1199 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows an attacker to crashthe Linux kernel by simulating amateur radio from the user space, resultingin a null-ptr-deref vulnerability and a use-after-free vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1199` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5

No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4

No subscription required
